item.description:
INTRO:
Beekeeper is a family friendly game for children and adults to enjoy. The game consists of 37 Hexagonal Playing Pieces, 1 set of instructions and a nice Black Cloth Pouch w/ drawstrings to hold all the pieces! Set-up time is approx. 2-3 minutes with playtime amounting to 5-10 minutes, and this game can be played with up to 6 players.
 GAMEPLAY:
1st) dump out the hexagonal pieces onto your playing surface and find the queen chit (she has an image on each side of the chit so it should be easy to find her).
2nd)Place the queen in the middle of the playing surface.
3rd)Arrange the rest of the pieces (beekeeper logo side facing up) around the queen piece until you have 3 rows around the queen. (The playing surface should resemble a giant hexagonal shape, or honeycomb)
4th) Youngest player gets to go first by pulling 1 chit from the game (*NOTE* only pieces with 3 open sides can be removed from the arranged pieces). He/She will then flip over the piece and find the following;
BEE POINTS: These give you points to win the game
ANIMALS: These guys make you lose turns
HONEY TOKENS: You need at least 6 honey tokens to pull the queen from her throne when she has at least 3 open sides and end the game and with her you get 10 bee points.
BEE NET or HONEY EXTRACTOR: Use these cards once during gameplay to steal a bee chit or honey chit from an opposing player (once used they must be discarded to the side)
 Once the first player's turn is complete, then the person to the left is next to pull a piece from the hive.

ENDING AND WINNING THE GAME:
 The game is ended when the Queen chit is removed from the playing surface, which can happen two ways;
 One way is if she has at least 3 open sides and someone has 6 or more HONEY TOKENS.
 The other way is if there are no more chits to pull from the game, then the queen is rewarded to the next player's turn.
 The game is won by the person with the most Bee Points, so count up all of your drones', larvas', workers' and queen bee's chit values and that will be your Bee Point count.

Norshanks Game Cause:
 As with most of the games that Norshanks Games will be marketing, this game is tied to Beekeeping Associations in various countries, and every time a game is sold, part of the profits will be donated to the Purchaser's Current Country of Residence National Beekeeping Association.
 The donated funds will go to the Beekeeping Associations to help save the bees by; researching colony collapse disorder, increasing bee populations, educating the public about the importance of bees, and many other great projects!
 With your help we can help reverse the collapse of bee populations everywhere!

Game is expected to be ready for shipment in Winter.

name.value: Star Wars: Battle of the Force

item.description:
A simple Star Wars themed Card game.
Each turn a villain card is revealed and players use their 8 hero cards to bid on them. Different villains give different points; Darth Vader, however, gives negative points.

item.description:
"Shake and toss the dice! Race against the clock to create the most words using the letters rolled. Now you have words on your mind!"

Words on my Mind is a word dice game in which players roll lettered dice and then all use the same dice to form as many words as possible in the time allowed, in almost a simplified Boggle-style game.

Five-Minute Delivery is a game where players take on the role of bundle deliverers in the goblin town of Goobliopolis. On a randomly constructed board, players listen to directions from the narrator on an MP3 as they try to deliver bundles to various locations. The locations are determined by Address Cards each player gets, and the routes are different based on the layout of the tiles that make up the town. Because the length of the game is determined by the MP3's that work with the game, it takes... five minutes to play. (The title seems obvious now, doesn’t it?) The game is played in real time (meaning everybody plays at the same time with no turns). A variety of MP3’s give players different directions and (along with the random town layout) different play experiences every time.

A party game with cards of three categories: Description of words, Pantomime, Lists

Split into two teams! The more the better! Make sounds, pantomime or anyhting you can to describe the most words to your teammates!

Mech Arena is a tactical card game where you pilot giant Mechs in gladiatorial combat. Where your goal is to defeat your opponents by shooting, hacking and kicking their Mechs to bits. An easy task, save for the fact they are trying to do the same to you. Equal parts MMA and demolition derby it is no wonder Mech Arena is the sport of choice for all citizens of the twenty third Century.

To get started build your Mech Deck from a variety of System, Chassis and Pilot microdecks. Then combat each other in a turn based battle on the arena game board. The battles are quick pace and every draw and play of the card counts because when your deck is depleted you are out of the game.

item.description:
1:34 a.m. --- A fired bookkeeper’s message on Twitter: 3-SAME or SUM-15.
1:39 a.m. --- The information leaked out few minutes ago, and already the cartel chief's server has been attacked. 
The stake is high, therefore the hackers not only have to break the firewall but to fight against each other ... 

Hack Trick is a game of deduction and combinations where players generate numbers to finally obtain a valid password - a three-digit code with the same digits (ex. 222, 555) or with their sum being 15 (ex. 852, 159, 357). Each time a card is played, the player adds a number to the sequence, and marks the generated number - the sum of the last two numbers - on the keypad (places a marker on the key). Because the keypad is a magic square (the sum of each row, column or diagonal is 15) the object of the game is to line up three markers or place three on the same key.

Hack Trick gameplay is deceptively simple, but you’ll see, that it hides many combinations. In his turn, the player may ask the sum of the opponent’s hand, than play a card or draw. When he plays a card he may capture opponent markers, moreover, he may sacrifice a marker to force his opponent to play a card in the next turn, or contrarily, protect himself from being forced. Markers can be used in five different ways, but be careful, the player who runs out loses!

Finally, the winner will be the player who knows how to defend and attack the positions, when to gather information, when to use the doubles, when to start a forced series, but above all how to find the right balance between forming a strong hand and tend to the final goal on the board.

item.description:
Litterateur is a card-drafting and word-building game for up to five players.

For five rounds, players will draft cards into their hands and use these cards, along with three common cards, to produce a word. the player with the best word will get to choose any three cards in play to put into their score pile. The player in second place will get two cards and players in third and fourth place will get one card each.

In the sixth round, players will use these previously scored cards to produce a final word. The player with the best word in this final round wins the game.

To win, players must draft wisely at the beginning and end of each round.

Part of Bandai's Party Joy series of lighter boardgames. (#27)

This game about home delivery in Japan.

The players draw luggage card, load them on their trucks and gain victory points when the deliver them at their destination. However, the destinations are not easily found. Moreover, there is a deadline, depending on the type of luggage, and players receive no points when they are to late.
In addition, when a player catches up with a truck of another player, he make take some of his luggage.

It became stereotypical pick-and-deliver game, published in Japan about three years earlier than Auf Achse.

Already out of print.

into the woods is a forest walk simulator.

Find your way through the forest, enjoy the scenery, or - dare to explore the forest in the rising mist.. will you be able to find your way home?

The game uses unique semi transparent tiles to create a three dimensional landscape drawing for the player to explore - and get lost in.

To win the game you have to reach the other end of the forest,
fulfill a task on your way (like climbing the highest mountain),
and finally return home safely.

But beware of the fog: The longer your expediton takes, the foggier it gets - and getting stuck in the mist means losing the game...

D6 Shooter is a fast paced western themed press your luck dice & card game for 2-4 players. Take on the roll of Bounty Hunter and gain a good reputation by hunting down & capturing wanted bandits that plague a small town. Gather enough "Rep" points to work your way from Bounty Hunter all the way to Marshall. Better hurry, you are not the only one after the job!

The game includes over 100 game cards, 10 General Store cards & 6 custom shooter dice. On each player's turn, they flip over a card to hunt for a wanted bandit. Each bandit has a sequence of suit symbols (heart, diamond, spade & club). The tougher the bandit the more suit symbols will appear. The player can roll and re-roll the 6 dice up to 3 times to try to capture the bandit by matching these symbol. Jokers are wild and can be used as any suit. Skulls, if rolled, render the die out of play. Once captured you can stop & collect the bandit by moving them into you jail, or you may press your luck & try to grab more bandits. If you decide to continue on your hunt you get to re-roll all of your dice, minus any skulls previously rolled, for three more chances to capture the new bandit. Lose any bandit on your turn & you lose ALL the bandits collected this round!

Each bandit has a reward amount for their capture as well as 1 to 2 reputation points to put towards your promotions. Higher ranks gain the ability to re-roll a certain number of skull dice.

Reward money can be traded in for General Store cards which can help you on your journey or played to hinder another player's. But choose wisely, spending your reward money will sacrifice the Rep you have gained for those bandits!

The game deck also contains event cards. Some events award you with General Store cards by completing a rolling task. Other events may cause you to lose the bandits you are wrangling, or have your previously captured bandits escape from your jail!

Be the first player to be promoted to Marshall to win!

Think you have what it takes to win the west? Then roll into D6 Shooter! Yeee-haaw!

Asterix & Obelix Mau Mau is based on Mau Mau, with magic potions and wild boar hunting showing up to surprise Mau Mau veterans. Whoever best proves to have Gallic cunning and clout wins!

item.description: Rome: from Republic to Empire is a solo game in which you take control of the Roman Empire in the period from 200BC to 100AD. You will need to conquer the provinces of Europe, the Middle East and North Africa using a card based conflict system. Gather resources, using a dice rolling mechanism, to expand the glory of Rome in each of six key areas: Military, Spiritual, Production, Commerce, Political and Wonders. However, beware! This is the time of the slave uprising and so if you fail to keep your citizens happy they will revolt and ultimately overthrow your rule.

A game of Catan in Chocolate. Build settlements, roads, citites and knights to become the champion of a chocolate Catan world.

Contents:

 32 pieces of chocolate with the following printed on them
 15 settlements(1VP)/cities(2VP), 3 each in 5 different colors
 9 roads
 8 knights (0.5VP each)
 
 90 resource cards
 1 spinner




At the start each player receives two settlements in different colors and a road to bind them together (similar to the layout of Catan the Card Game). Active player then spins a spinner which contains 7 possible outcomes, one for each resource, one year of plenty where the players may choose a resource for free, and a robber which will rob the players of half their resources if they have more than 7. For each resource field on the spinner, three colors of settlements are shown. These colors will produce the resource in question for all players when the spinner lands there. Then a player may build new things by paying the appropriate amount and, either take a new piece of chocolate from the box and add it to their display, or for cities, turn over the settlement piece to its back side which have a city of the same color. Settlements must have a road between them, and knights must be placed next to a settlement/city. Also, each settlement/city may only have one knight attached to it. Trading is also allowed, either between players or with the bank 3:1
First player to reach 5VP wins.

Objective: Be the first leading your riding stable to biggest success.
As a owner of a riding stable each player moves along a circle according rolled number; the space you are landing on requires certain activities like giving correct answers, buying horses, participating in tournaments, 'event cards' (scandals)...
depending on result you may move your meeple forward on a ranking list. First player entering target zone (250 victory points) is the winner.

From the publisher:

Nuts about Mutts is a high-energy game that is challenging enough to keep all players on their toes but simple enough to be enjoyed by the whole family. The pile in the center of the table is your dogs’ home! You can send your dog home if its color, number, or dog breed matches the card on top of the home pile. The home pile is also where fun “wild cards” like the mutt, flea, fire hydrant, and pedigree cards are played. The first player to empty their hand wins, so players want to get all their dogs back home as fast as possible while ruthlessly preventing other players from doing the same! If players choose to use advanced game rules, all players must be on the lookout for opportunities to steal someone’s turn by matching a card to the one in play or starting a numeric run. Being a sly dog is the best way to succeed at Nuts about Mutts!

Star Patrol is the second Pocket Option minigame created as a tribute to the $2.95 hex & counter games from the 70s and 80s. In Star Patrol, you design and build customized ships using a ship frame, weapons, and special technological breakthroughs to give each design a unique play style. Ships are designed and built in secret, with weapons and upgrades remaining secret until each is used for the first time. The variety of mounts, ships, weapons, and upgrades gives players thousands of possible builds. Opponents duel in a deep space arena that may include asteroids, moons, and planets. Gameplay uses Newtonian space flight mechanics, including gravity wells, linear acceleration, orientation thrusts, and inertia.

Family game in which you throw the dice and move pawns.
Number of Players 2 - no limit but above the 8 players played not very well.
The game refers to the fairy tales.

The players have to move their three pawns on the track of their color from space 1 to space 100. Movement is determined by the "Verolette" in the center of the game board. The "Verolette" gives results from 1 to 9.
Some spaces have a Symbol with Special meaning.
Dot: Move 3 spaces forward and move an opponent 3 spaces backward. 
Cross: Move 6 spaces forward and move an opponent 6 spaces backward.
Crossed dot: Move 9 spaces forward and move an opponent 9 spaces backward.

The players have to move 4 or 6 pawns into the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. Under certain conditions, the mpawns can change from an outer into an inner circle. On the green circle there are 4 meeting places. The first two opponents to meet there combine their pawns (stack one on the other) and are allies for the rest of the game. They win or lose as one. The combined pawns can be separated, if an opponent lands on a space that is already occupied by two combined pawns.

name.value: Trivial Pursuit: Pop Culture – Quiz Night

item.description:
It's popular culture- in a box!
Trivial Pursuit Popular Culture Quiz Night edition is all about entertainment, gossip and trends of modern times. The all-new question cards include NZ popular culture and cover everything from sporting heroes to fashion icons and mainstream media.

It’s like charades if charades made a lot of questionable choices, got hooked on meth, and became sexually insatiable. One player draws a card and silently acts out the dirty word or phrase. Every one else tries to guess while trying not to shit themselves laughing. There are also wild cards with special missions and side games that will embarrass and delight.

There are games that cross the line, this game screws the line and give it the herp.

In the beginning, the oldest player in the group is named The Warden of Filth. The Warden draws a card and silently acts out the dirty word or phrase. The first player to correctly guess wins the round and holds onto the card. After each round, a new player becomes Warden following a clockwise or counter-clockwise direction.

Some cards have special missions and side games that will have you sharing your darkest secrets, arm wrestling on someone's back, yelling "penis," and learning more about your friends than you ever wanted to know.

item.description:
In the grim world of kindergarten, where juice is the fuel of chaos, where the playground is the ultimate arena, where the struggle against tantrums is real, the teachers, the guardians of order remain ever faithful, ready to jump in and take the ball away, if they have to.

While the situation in the battlefield appears calm, hostilities may break out at any moment. The yard remains rife with dangers, and the tribes of kindergardeners shall be unleashed upon each other any minute now.

Who will prevail in the ultimate battle between light and darkness, between order and chaos, between disinfectant and sharp objects?

In Operation: Kindergarten, the players are teachers that are trying to keep children safe, and return them to their classrooms - and they will not stop at anything to do so, including disrupting their fellow teachers' routines.

Using a dice placement mechanism, the players direct the movement distance & direction of children, affect where the retiring head teacher will be inspecting next, and decide on their own movement and actions throughout the day.

item.description:
In CVlizations, you take the role of a leader of a tribe, and you are charged with the task of "writing" its CV (Curriculum Vitae - résumé). To do so, you choose which orders to give and which inventions, tools, buildings and ideologies to develop. The happiness of your people depends on you.

Gameplay is built around action selection. Each turn, every player chooses two order cards, and the strength of the action depends on how many other players have chosen that action. Players manage their resources to develop ideas, and in the end the one who collected the most happiness points wins.

item.description:
Alone is a sci-fi survival horror / dungeon crawler game that will pit a single, stranded hero against 1-3 evil masterminds who will do their best to stop the hero from completing a quest to discover the truth and save his companions.

The Evil players always have the full map of the scenario in front of them, hidden behind a huge screen. They manage all the events happening during the game, and try to stop the Hero from completing his objectives.

The Hero can only see the Sector of the map he is in, and from there he will have to explore the map. All kind of horrors may be hiding in the darkness, so he will have to be cautious. At the end of each round, the portions of the map he explored will be removed from the table: only the Sector he is in will stay visible... the Hero will have to put his memory to test, if he doesn't want to get lost!

The story of the game will be unfolded through several scenarios, each one divided into several chapters. Each chapter has an objective for the Hero to complete, while the Evil players will have to stop him (or try to fulfill a different objective of their own). The outcome of each chapter will influence the gameplay of the subsequent one: each scenario is conceived with a branching storyline that can adapt to the actions of the players: if the Hero completes his goals, his life will be easier in the next chapter... but that is also true for the Evil players!

item.description:
WÅ­ Xíng is a family friendly hand management game where players attempt to gain 15 points in each of the five elements of the Tao.

Players use the creation power of the elements during the creation phase in order to eliminate all cards from their hand. Once a player is able to discard all of their cards the destruction phase begins.

During the destruction phase all players that still have cards work together to destroy as many of the remaining cards as they can.

Once all possible destructions are made, the winner of the hand is given the points for the remaining cards, and a new hand is played.

The Peloponnese — home of the mighty and proud city-states, the "poleis". In the Peloponnes Card Game, you lead one of them through the ages, gaining fame and prosperity while weathering disaster. Over eight rounds, you develop your civilization by claiming new territory, constructing prestigious buildings, and increasing your population. Can you balance the pursuit of glory with the needs of your people?

The Peloponnes Card Game is based on the Peloponnes board game; a few details were simplified, while the strategic projections and the feeling of the game are new!

item.description:
From the publisher:

Two bands of nomadic survivors are on a high-speed trek down the rubble of Interstate 9 to what is fabled to be the last source of water. Will you be able to quench your thirst or will die trying? In an odd mix inspired by Wings of War, Mille Borne, and Mad Max, we have a head to head card game with dice rolling, location smashing, and card shooting fun!

A deck of Distance Cards is shuffled and placed between both players. A deck of Item Cards is also shuffled and place between both players. Finally, a set of six vehicle cards (representative of each player's car layout) and a gear box card is given to each player.

Players take turns drawing cards from the Distance Deck and rolling 1d6 to try to beat the difficulty value listed on each card. Different locations have different difficulty values, sometimes causing damage to vehicles or rewarding players with items like armor or weapons. As players successfully maneuver through locations, they add these cards to their Distance Traveled deck.

Players may also choose to attack each other to cause damage to their vehicles, use items to boost their position, or press their luck and avoid disastrous terrain (no one likes minefields).

The player with the most Distance Traveled cards at the end of the deck or have gained 10+ cards than their opponent wins.

Subtitle: Being the truthful account of a tabletop wargame for wee ships in the Age of Discovery, put down in writing by Nicholas Wright Esq. and accurately rendered through illustrations by Orestis ‘Orestix’ Ermeides Esq.

Galleys and Galleons is a standalone set of naval wargaming rules based on the Song of Blades engine. G&G allows players to fight out fast-paced naval battles without cluttering the table with charts or unnecessary record keeping. Note that no miniatures are included: players can use any sailing ship miniatures of any scale from any source they want.

Easy to learn, fast to play, games concluded in around one hour.

Flexible: designed for each player to command up to 6-7 ships, the rules are equally enjoyable playing one-on-one duels or small fleet actions with multiple players per side.

Although the core rules focus on early modern voyages of discovery, mercantile exploitation and piracy, additional rules cater to players wishing to sail for stranger shores with the inclusion of mythical beasts, submersibles and more.

Expansive - includes rosters for 36 historic vessels plus numerous shore forts, monsters and more.

name.value: Warhammer Quest: The Adventure Card Game
Warhammer Quest: El juego de cartas de aventuras

item.description:
Join forces with legendary heroes to brave the many dangers of a cavernous dungeon. Wield potent weapons and magic. Conquer hordes of vile monsters. Discover fabulous treasures.

Warhammer Quest: The Adventure Card Game is a cooperative game of heroic dungeon adventures for one to four players. Players assume the roles of some of the Old World's most iconic heroes, then venture into the shadows to battle ghouls, Goblins, Skaven, giant bats, swarms of rats, and other monsters.

Can you survive their relentless onslaught? Can you press deeper into their lair to find the evil villain that drives them forward? There are only two ways for your quest to end – in death or in glory!

item.description:
Exciting and educational boardgame for learning about the Kanza language and culture. The traditional language of the Kanza people is Kadnzele, or simply Kanza. ALthugh it is a separate language, it is closely related to the languages of the Osage, Ponca, Omaha and Quapaw tribes. Kanza is a Siouan language, and so it also has similarities in grammar and vocabulary with loway, Otoe-Missouria, the languages of the Sioux peoples, as well as more distant ties to Crow, Mandan, Hidatsa, Biloxi and others.

Wajiphanyin is played as a roll and move game. Points are awarded for translations from English to Kanza, Identifying animals, other objects and words with the Kanza words, and translating Kanza to English. An emphasis is placed on worlds from the natural environment. Score sheets are used to keep track of the points and task. The player with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner. The duration of the game (usually time) should be decided prior to playing.

During a long and very devastating period in the history of the tribe, usage of the language began to taper off dramatically. This trend continued into the twentieth century until only a handful of the fullbloods in the 1970's could speak fluently. Today all of these elders are gone. The Kanza people today speak English as a first language, but many can still understand and use the Kanza words and phrases.

The Kaw Nation is interested in both preserving the language and more importantly reviving it. The Kanza Language Prodject is a special department of the tribal operation devoted to this task. This game is an important part of the education and preservation of this language and its importance in the culture.

Snowblind is a press-your-luck and risk-management dice game in which 1-4 players take control of a polar expedition, racing to be the first to return from the South Pole.

The object of the game is to collect the most prestige points. The further you advance your flag, and the more men who survive the Antarctic winter at the end of the game, the more prestige your expedition receives. This requires careful management of crates, food and camps: without supplies, your explorers will not survive.

Play proceeds over a series of rounds. Within each round, players may make as many moves as they like, from those available, with each additional move becoming increasingly dangerous. In more detail, each turn, players may take an action (which involves taking a risk die from the action board, adding the die to their dice pool, then taking a corresponding action), or they choose to pass. Actions include moving explorers and crates, hunting for food, collecting research, and building camps. After completing an action, the active player rolls all the dice in their dice pool. High numbers result in exposure, the loss of supplies (crates and food), explorers being incapacitated, and even death. Exposure results can be offset by explorers remaining together (company) and the building of camps.

A round ends when all players have passed. At the end of the round, a weather card is drawn that may cause additional attrition, then the next round begins. When the pack ice card is drawn from the weather deck, one last round is played and the game ends.

item.description:
Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia is a fast-paced, dice-driven dungeon crawl board game set in the Arcadia Quest universe where players control Heroes that explore three levels of a dungeon filled with monsters, traps and treasure! Bosses, special rooms and countless surprises await the Heroes, but only one can be the first to reach the final level and become the undisputed champion of the Realm!

In Masmorra, players get to roll and re-roll a pool of Dice that guides their actions for their turn, and a unique dungeon is created as players lay down tiles while exploring it and fighting off monsters that are represented by special dice! But Heroes must also be aware of opponent Heroes, as they'll be able to use cards to disrupt their carefully laid-out plans!

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to Terrinoth, adventurer! Runebound is a fantasy adventure board game for two to four players, inviting you to play as one of six heroes wandering the realm and taking whatever quests you may encounter. But all is not well in the realm: evil is awakening once more in the form of Margath the Dragonlord or the Corpse King, Vorakesh. Only you and your rival heroes stand a chance of stopping this threat before all Terrinoth is consumed in darkness.

Two distinct scenarios give shape to your adventures in Terrinoth, challenging you to battle undead or outwit a dragon, even as you explore lost ruins and forgotten forests and take on quests across the realm. New adventure cards and story cards for each scenario make every game unique, alongside the ability to customize your hero with over one-hundred different skills and assets. Whether you play as a mage bristling with spells or a powerful warrior, every game of Runebound invites you to experience an incomparable adventure. Take your first steps into the world of Terrinoth!

item.description:
The Ferrymen is set in the Ancient Greek underworld. Players take the part of ferrymen carrying souls of the dead across the river Acheron to the Gates of Hades. A player's turn consists of two phases – the Souls of the Dead Phase and the Ferry Phase. During the Souls of the Dead Phase, players move souls along the Path of the Dead toward docked ferries. During the Ferry Phase, players move their ferries along the river Acheron.

Different souls (Lovers, Families, Spartans, Merchants, etc.) have different movement rates, restrictions, special abilities and delivery fares. Players vie to maneuver beneficial combinations of souls onto their ferry and detrimental combinations onto their opponents' ferries.

The monsters Cetus (a many-tentacled river horror), and Cerberus (guardian of the Gates of Hades) pose a hazard to players. Three random Gods & Goddesses are in play each game. Players who sacrifice the most bulls to a God or Goddess receive their favor; players who sacrifice the fewest bulls receive their wrath. Favor is generally beneficial and wrath is generally harmful. Effects vary by God or Goddess and have a large impact on gameplay. A key component of strategy is that nearly any positive effect can be negative in some circumstances and vice versa. For example, an upgraded ferry is larger than the default ferry, but may take more turns to load.

A player wins the game when they deliver nine souls to the Gates of Hades or accumulate 30 coins worth of money.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: A journey through the German national parks. The experience game for World Animal Week 1993. A journey to the 10 national parks is a journey through the 16 German federal states. A visitor to a national park can earn points by showing that he knows a lot about animals and nature (activity cards/question cards). Through special events, but you also win or lose points. The game is over when the first player has visited all ten national parks. He gets a bonus of 5 points . The winner is whoever has the most points at the end .

Game no 3 in a Family of 7 games called "Die kleinen Feinen". There are only 10 Cards inlcuded - rules can be found on the website - or you can buy a set of cards with seperate printed rules sheet.
Cards are both sided and show nine (out of ten) colored elves and nine (out of ten) tools. Just one card is placed in the middle and players have to find the missing elf and the missing tool. Player who gets it right first will win a chip (not included in the game).

You are a super parent who promised your child the best vacation ever at Iwanna’s Theme Park. You’ve read the guides, and heard about how stressful it is for some parents, especially with that top of the hour marketing blitz, but you have a plan and are good at reacting to situations, so you aren’t worried about losing your mind on this vacation. All you have to do is make it back to the main entrance with your child comfortable and satisfied before the park closes, and you’ll win the game.

Designed for the 2015 Solitaire Print and Play contest, Iwanna's Theme Park uses a Mancala style mechanic to deal with potential disasters on your vacation. Cubes of multiple colors move around a Mancala styled "Brain Board," tracking potential problems with crowds, hunger and bathroom needs, and your child's craving for a special souvenir. Grouping too many cubes of the same color create a potential for disaster. The player will have to plan ahead, and deposit the right cubes at the right times to prevent the vacation from getting out of control.

A Vassal module designed by Chad Mestdagh is available at this link:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0WBVnUE4NbHZWJ2b0VtR0NrZVU/view

A game about newspaper and newspaper hoaxes. In several different variants players try to come up with headlines and news stories to fool the others to believe them while at the same time guessing the true headline or news.

name.value: The Princess Bride: I Hate to Kill You

item.description:
The Princess Bride: I Hate to Kill You is a quick, but crafty, dice and card game that recreates (and re-imagines) the sword duels from The Princess Bride. Play as the Man in Black, Inigo Montoya, Count Rugen, or Prince Humperdinck.

Each player starts with six dice and ten cards. Each turn, both players roll their dice, then play a card which may modify the outcome. Some cards modify their own dice, some modify the opponent's dice, and others return dice to the active pool. The player with the highest total of Swords scores a hit and must remove a die (showing a sword) from their active pool. As the tension builds, and players lose more dice and more cards, the first player to score five hits wins the duel and the game.

link.value: The Princess Bride: 30th Anniversary Celebration Pack

item.description:
Hasta La Vista, Baby is the ultimate tabletop wargame for players of multiplayer shooters and casual tabletop gamers. We designed the game to recreate the feeling of an intensive online match and included all the popular modes you already know how to play.

The game is designed for two players. Each player commands a team of soldiers and sends them on various missions like defusing bombs, occupying strategic positions or capturing a flag. To succeed, you are going to use the strengths and weaknesses of your soldiers, assign tactical equipment, and dominate your opponent.

And just before you win, don't forget to rub it in by saying: "Hasta La Vista, Baby!"

Game no. 2 (of 7) in a family called "Die Kleinen Feinen". Each game contains only 10 Cards. Rules has to be downloaded or might be available separate.
In ZEP! there are 4 cards with red airships and 4 cards with green airships, plus 2 cards to measure distance. Also a D6, a D20, and some Chips are needed.
Each players has 6 action points to spend for movement and fighting for all his ships. The D20 will be used as a bullet to hit opponents shipcards and causes damage. The last ship in air will win.
